website_summaries.verdict: For drivers who seek an affordable upgrade to the original emergency scissor jack, look no further. Great price point, easy to operate, and extremely stable.
pros: Very compact when folded – fits easily in trunk
Wide base plates for additional stability
Speed adapter for power drills available
cons: Does not work well on inclined surfaces
Can be difficult to crank under load

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, then...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to lift a volvo wagon to change motor mounts instead of using the one supplied with the car. I've lifted the front end a total of 2 times (one wheel lifted at a time, jackstands placed, other side done) and today when I used it was very hard to turn the handle with no load. When I tried lifting the wagon, it kept slipping back down with a clunk clunk, and it appears the large "nut" that does the work of lifting opposite the handle hole is stripped out partially and doesn't lift reliably. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste ur money. This jack broke before we could even use it. My husband jacked up car turned to get spare tire & the car came crashing down. Jack split in half. This was first time trying to use. It’s past the 30 day return but im still going to try to return this piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: nicole  c. ransom

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I've weighed my truck with everything in it and the whole rear axle is 3000# or less. I used this jack to try to change my right rear tire and it bent and then the handle pin twisted out leaving me stranded. There no way this thing is rated for 3000# or it should have been able to lift the whole rear axle.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Good solid jack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This jack appears solidly built and has much larger "feet" than the stock Amazon picture, which makes it more stable in use. It lifts a corner of my 4400 pound Tesla without difficulty. I like that it has a relatively flat lifting surface; like some others here I use a hockey puck between the jack top and the lift pad of my car. Comes with a long handle/crank that folds for easy storage. I couldn't find a better scissor jack at local stores, much less at anything close to this price. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Big and bulky
customer_reviews.text: Very serious jack, but not as pictured. The bottom plate is 15 inches long and 4 7/8 inches wide. Probably far too big to fit in the "jack area" in anyone's car trunk. Folded up it is 17 1/2 inches long by 4 7/8 inches wide by 3 3/4 inches high. The small "platform" on the top is 2 3/4 inches long by 1 3/4 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: William P. Carlucci

customer_reviews.title: Worked a few times
customer_reviews.text: This was cheap and was flexible in options for use, so I gave it a try. Unfortunately, after a handful of uses, it simply spins in place and won't raise anything. It turned out to be a bit of a challenge to use, when it did work. The impact wrench would slip out constantly, and the nut and bolt wouldn't stay fastened with all the torque. When using a tire wrench, it was too wobbly to rely on. I would spend the money on something more reliable, if you need this in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Trianine

customer_reviews.title: Threads failed on first use!
customer_reviews.text: One of the two units I got failed completely the very first time I used it to jack up my Subaru Impreza. The threads on the jack stripped and seized completely. I had to use the other jack to get the unit out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice, safe jack.
customer_reviews.text: I just got around to using this jack after many months. It worked adequately, but seemed a little more difficult to turn than a Honda scissor jack, so I gave it only four stars. The wide foot is reall nice and stable, but make sure you put some grease on the long threaded rod before using. The manufacturer didn't grease it up well and that's why it was a bit harder to turn the jack. All in all, a good jack--certainly a vast improvement on my original OEM vintage VW jack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Donahoe

customer_reviews.title: Works but use caution.
customer_reviews.text: Remember dont lift up your vehicle on a slope. Aside from that the base plate has a groove that props up the jack. Please be careful. my garage has a slight incline and the jack slipped because of the grooves prop-ing it up. Also super easy to scratch the jack. The box arrived torn to sh!t, but on time.
customer_reviews.author: Gravitight

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this jack for its low profile. When it was delivered, its box was torn on one end from poor packaging by Amazon. Upon inspection of the jack, I was really disappointed by the quality..I know it's made in freaking China but come on. The metal is so thin that you can deflect it with your own hands. Because of this I wouldn't try and lift a car to change a tire or anything ...maybe it would be OK for a Go Cart or lawn tractor but not a full size car. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: RonG

customer_reviews.title: this is several times nicer to use then what comes ...
customer_reviews.text: this is several times nicer to use then what comes with most cars. handle is easier to use and the foot is riveted on instead of just tack welded. This is the jack you throw in the tool box and don't cry over if it grows legs, it gets the job done, and its cheap.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Flexible base you can bend and flex with your hand
customer_reviews.text: The base is super weak and flexy. I dont know how anyone could think this is a safe jack. The base could easily fold if the car or truck rocked backwards for forwards. The base would fold like a cheap suit. You'd have to be crazy to get under a car with this jack without a jack stand in place. Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Dirt Digler

customer_reviews.title: Operating Handle too Short
customer_reviews.text: This is a very light duty jack even though it is rated at 1.5 Tons. The two part, folding crank handle light duty and is very short. If the jack needs to be pushed under the vehicle to reach the lifting pad, the handle will not reach. You end up trying to operate the crank handle from under the vehicle in order to raise the scissor jack. I was unable to use it on a roadside flat tire because of the handle length. Consider spending a few extra dollars for a more heavy duty jack with a longer operating handle.
customer_reviews.author: john h.

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know just how much weight this jack will REALLY handle, but it is very useful around the property. I like the large base, and also the fact that it can be lowered fairly low. I don't think that I would use it to jack up a heavy vehicle, but for raising my Bush Hog, heavy furniture, etc it has worked very well. The handle could be a better design, but for the money I like this jack. I am NOT a paid reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: Harold T. Read

customer_reviews.title: It works very well.  But, it's bulky.  Perhaps too large for small vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: This jack is rather bulky. It is larger than the typical scissor jack that comes (used to come), with some cars. I bought it to use with a small SUV. Fortunately, my SUV has plenty of storage space for this jack. As others have mentioned, the flat BASE on this jack is HUGE. It's about 4 inches wide and about 14 inches long. Therefore, this jack may not fit into a smaller "jack compartment". I tested this jack on my SUV. It lifted the vehicle quite easily. To those who said that it's hard to turn the crank, I did not have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdGen

customer_reviews.title: Used this jack to level cabinet doors.
customer_reviews.text: Having never used a car jack in my life, I ordered this because someone commented that they used it to lift furniture. I have a huge cabinet that was moved, and as a result the doors didn't line up when closed. All I needed to do was jack up each end of the cabinet less than an inch (the cabinet weighs a ton-really) and put shims under the legs to level the cabinet. The jack was easy to use and I'm happy I purchased it. I definitely recommend this jack, at least for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Paula C.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. Its red. Unfortunately, i tried to use it and it bent.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for full size trucks.
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently had a flat on our Silverado and we bought this product to replace the factory one that had gone missing but this jack would not lift the truck high enough for us to get the spare tire on. Luckily, there was an AutoZone down the street so she bought a bottle jack and that did the trick. Unfortunately, I'm not able to return this product because I didn't need it right away but hopefully this information saves some people from being stranded somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shin

customer_reviews.title: I am taking benefits from this jack
customer_reviews.text: I changed my tyres, brake pad , and bleed brake oil fluids by using this jack. This jack is easy to use as it has wide base surface. You can easily adjust this tool ob you car’s body chesses. Than you can easily lift either side of your vehicles . This is very easy to use. You don’t have to do hard work to use this powerful tool. I have used it many time and have had many benefit from this tool in really hard time too.
customer_reviews.author: Rayez

customer_reviews.title: teeth never lined up
customer_reviews.text: poor quality control. teeth on bottom never lined up and bent when trying to cycle the jack. otherwise would have probably been a decent jack. wasted money and too cheap to worry about returning.
customer_reviews.author: MHousehold

customer_reviews.title: BIG RED T10152 Torin Steel Scissor Lift
customer_reviews.text: I used this jack to lift an RV trailer to so I could level it out so the refrigerator would run correctly. It worked like a charm and didn't show any signs of stress or bending during the procedure. Seems to be a nicely made scissor jack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SJK

customer_reviews.title: Nice for changing a flat
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I lost the jack in my car and had to either carry around a floor jack or risk getting a flat. This jack is small and easy to use. It's great for storing in your car to change a tire in an emergency. I wouldn't suggest it as your main jack in your garage - because like all scissor jacks it's more on the sketchy side. But this one seems as well built as you could hope for. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: bolt stripped already, I would send it back but ...
customer_reviews.text: bolt stripped already, I would send it back but I used it already. Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basic and thats all you need.
customer_reviews.text: The more simple things end up being more reliable then the fancy stuff. Either way yes, It delivers as advertised even though I only had to jack my car twice a few years ago for maintenance. Its a good jack for little cars like Focus, Fiesta, Smart, Fusion, Impala, Altima, Tesla Model 3's, Etc, not for large vehicles unless you wanna strain yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ominous

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, looks better than the pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I could not find a jack more solidly built at Walmart or the Automotive stores in my city. Solidly built, and cheap price on Amazon. I highly advise buying this jack. The shipment DOES include the long handle.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Schrodemier

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight at best
customer_reviews.text: Was using it on polaris ranger 1000, maybe 1500 lbs at most. Worked okay on concrete floor in garage but if you have any unstable terrain you are using on (like hard pack snow), the outside wings on the base will fold on you. I imagine it will do the same on sand or even a little mud. As long as you only plan on using it for super hard surface I suppose it will be okay, just dont take it out in the field.
customer_reviews.author: ulric leblanc

customer_reviews.title: Collapses to a small size
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a strong jack. Be aware that it takes a significant amount of cranking to get it to full extension due to its high mechanical advantage. Recommend having a piece of wood 8X8 inch or so, as a stable base. The foot is kind of narrow. Easily lifts one side of my small trailer, and stows neatly. Cannot leak fluid like a hydraulic so is a good emergency tool.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowjacket

customer_reviews.title: Still better than many other scissor jacks I've tried
customer_reviews.text: End threads are already getting a little tight after only about 10 uses. Still better than many other scissor jacks I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Evan O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Seems okay after trying it out at home....
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing, I read some negative reviews of this jack that gave me pause. I decided to give it the benefit of the doubt before passing judgement. It did a good job jacking up one corner of my Honda Fit and fit in the spare tire well where the factory used to go. Build quality seems ok. I’ll report if I have problems in the future. Reading other reviews, maybe Torin has issues with quality control....
customer_reviews.author: Abigail B

customer_reviews.title: Less Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the wide base, but it started to bend even on a flat, level surface with the jack positioned straight up and not leaning to one side or the other. The crank handle was good until it started getting chewed up at the point where it turns the screw in the jack. Glad it didn’t cost much, which is probably the reason it didn’t hold up. This should be labeled as a ‘single use’ item.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: and this thing cranked my toyota yaris up and down like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Arrived much faster than expected. It was a little stiff the first time or two I tried it, but a few days after I bought it I had to replace the water pump on my engine, and this thing cranked my toyota yaris up and down like a champ. The base is larger than usual, which gives it more stability, but it still fits in the jack compartment of my car. Easy to use. The only note I'll make is that the saddle on top gets scratched a bit lifting the car up and down, but for the price it is a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Roderick

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a good purchase and definitely got the job done I got two for lifting up the front end of my truck to do some work. It worked great my only complaint is I wish there was somewhere to store the twist arm for it or even a clip on the side or something. Not a big deal just would be nice so you don’t have that walking away when not in use
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Decent product for the money. These jacks have a fairly coarse thread on the jack screw. Consequently, it is VERY hard to crank, especially when it is low to the ground. You will likely bend the wrench if the vehicle is too low when starting to jack the car. I also added rubber padding to the upper surface to prevent slipping. Product was shipped in a plain box with no packing material. No real damage this time but a very poor practice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2015 Kia Forte. I had to use it about a month after I recieved it to change a flat on the side of the road. It was a hot day and the situation was made worse by this jack... The mechanism to turn and lift the jack is not designed very well and the lever to turn it doesn't work too well... I had to exert excessive force to turn the mechanism in order to lift my vehicle. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P Masc

customer_reviews.title: Works well but very hard to lift a mini van
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different jacks over the years and this one requires the most strength to get my mini van up. Much more than the one that came with the vehicle. I used two jacks at once to rotate tires so got this as the second. If they made the cranking arm 50% longer, I think this would go from 2 to 4 stars easily.
customer_reviews.author: genegenre

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack At A Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I like this jack as most reviewers do. I used it to lift the front of my 3300 lb rear engine car. It works well but requires a little strength to operate. I disagree with the few reviewers that said it was not sturdy. I think that it is quite stable and solid. I’ve ordered another to keep in a 2nd vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer NY

customer_reviews.title: Lifts the car
customer_reviews.text: Buried in the manual is the ratings for the jack: only 1000 lb at the lowest lift, the one we are most likely to use when changing a flat tire. This jack may work for small cars but it would be over-stressed for a SUV. The claimed 1.5 T is only when the jack is most of the way up. The handle is difficult to turn when lifting a car and the rating is why.
customer_reviews.author: boB

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was pleased with the jack after a few uses. I pulled over on a parkway to help a stranded motorist change a flat,that’s when things went bad. The car was on an ever so slight decline,I placed jack under pinch weld,chocked the tire,e brake in. As I lifted the car I watch the jack start to bend,in about two seconds the jack is crushed under the car. It did not bend at the base but the bottom arm structure actually twisted! Not good,too dangerous. Invest in something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: prolead

customer_reviews.title: seems well built but handle is not a good design for me
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet tried to use it to lift a car, however I did use it to raise a metal frame bed, so I could clean. The jack seemed sturdy enough, altho I had a lot of trouble with the handle - it was difficult to tun, as the grip is a bit too short to get a good grasp of it while turning.. I think a pump type handle would be much easier. For the price though, I think it's pretty good, and would suffice.
customer_reviews.author: SLO

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but could not jack up 2000 pounds
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built, sturdy jack. I will use it for my ATV and light vehicles. I tried to use it on a 2000 pound load (trailer) and found that I could not operate it. I have no doubt it will hold 3000 pounds, but do not see how it can be used to lift that amount. I recommend it as an easy to store light-use jack.
customer_reviews.author: D. D. LeDu

customer_reviews.title: Simple and does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jack to go in my SMART Fortwo. It fits behind the seats and lifts the car without any problems. The handle is a bit awkward to use on the downside. Pro: inexpensive doesn't take up a lot of room Con: awkward handle I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Quill the Archer

customer_reviews.title: BIG Jack
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my OEM jack in my car with this as it is much less expensive than the OEM that BROKE. It is built much heavier with a higher capacity. It will not fit neatly in the original storage area, but good to toss in the trunk of an old car missing a Jack. (Make sure it will properly fit your particular vehicle operationally though)
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: OK, not the toughest
customer_reviews.text: Fell down once - not all that stable for heavy use, but if you use jack stands, it will probably still last you quite a few uses. Stay on level ground.
customer_reviews.author: PM Prime

customer_reviews.title: Can't mount
customer_reviews.text: Listed under trailer jacks but there is no way to mount it to the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carbonaro

customer_reviews.title: It's not big. It's pretty small in fact intended for little cars.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my truck but the little Nissan Rogue has one similar sized. In fact the one in the Nissan might be bigger. I should honestly send it back as it is useless to me. I found one to carry in the truck from one of my Suburbans. It is a lot beefier than this little red thing.
customer_reviews.author: Consaka Twain

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: I like this Jack, I purchased it to build a spare kit for my BMW 328 and this is great. it fits in the storage compartment in trunk under the cover and looks better than picture. Jack I received have a bigger base but works OK. it folds down perfect and not too difficult to use. handle is also fold able and easy to use with Jack.
customer_reviews.author: M Asim qamar

customer_reviews.title: Almost died, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a missing dealers jack in my wife's car. Went to change the brakes and the jack slipped on a flat, cement driveway. I had just come out from under the van, with the tire off. Had I been under the van still, it would have crushed me. I would never trust my life or the lives of my family to this cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Solid Jack
customer_reviews.text: Slightly larger than you ordinary automotive jack but at the same time its solid and turns easily. I liked it so much I bought 2. Went looking for jacks as a replacement for a Honda OEM jack and found nothing of note. This one is also reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: WallStreetsInsane

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and a much better upgrade than the stock one ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and a much better upgrade than the stock one that came with my car. I now keep this in my car instead of the stock one. If you want an extra piece of mind that the stock one (especially if it's one that's been used and rusted for years), get this one. It's about twice the size and weight than those that come with most compacts and sedans, but it's good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ain't Nobody Got Time to Review

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jack for my 2015 Malibu because my car did not come with a spare tire and jack. Bought a spare tire off ebay and this jack off amazon. My friends honda was due for an oil change and rotate and she couldn't find her jack so i got to use this one. It was an awesome and easy jack to use. I love this jack. I would recommend tbis jack if you need one.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as a replacement for a missing Jeep YJ Jack.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the same as all the other inexpensive scissor jacks. Works fine, great color. I was able to bolt it into the factory location for the jack (under the hood) of my '94 Wrangler YJ. I drilled two holes in the jack base to match the location of the factory inner fender, fasteners. Installed 1/4-20 grade 8 studs from below, and attached the jack with lock washers and wing-nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Sabayon Linux User

customer_reviews.title: Very happy especially consider the price
customer_reviews.text: Used this to lift each corner of a 1500lb CNC machine to lift it onto machine skates for maneuvering in my work shop. Combined with a 4x4 of solid maple between the jack and the machine, it worked perfectly for what I needed. Very happy especially consider the price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Sewell, Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Works like a car jack should.
customer_reviews.text: So, the used car I bought a few years ago didn't have a jack. I found this out when I got a flat tire. Now I've got this new jack. Out of sheer bloody-mindedness, I tested it upon arrival and it worked exactly as a jack should. I'll had good action, and smoothly lifted my car. Hopefully I never need it.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Rosas-Guyon

customer_reviews.title: Worked on an 07 Altima. Purchased to replace the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked on an 07 Altima. Purchased to replace the factory jack that got rained on and rusted. It was easier to get the car propped up vs the factory scissor jack. I keep it stored in the trunk in a seal bag. The only thing I wished it had was a slot/notch at the top to attach to the frame. Be sure to have jack stands under the car as well.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $20
customer_reviews.text: It's a cheap jack and familiar with the brand so i wasn't expecting much. Used to the first time. Jacked up my f150 with the factory jack Jacked up the front tire with this one. Bent the base plate and was extremely hard to crank. To literally compress the front spring on a half ton truck Go to harbor frieght
customer_reviews.author: Kalman Denning

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack, hand crank needs work
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple, sturdy jack. the problem is the metal hand crank. They really should have put a sleeve of some sort around the base. You turn it with one hand, and then hold the base with the other. Since there is no sleeve, the friction between your hand and the metal makes it difficult to turn. This small feature would have made the product better.
customer_reviews.author: Atown

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Sturdy Construction
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Solid construction --much better than one that typically comes with your vehicle. Do wish the top plate were a bit broader --but from an engineering standpoint, the top plate is probably sized to keep load centered. The Base plate is definitely wider/longer than what comes with a car.
customer_reviews.author: NightSky

customer_reviews.title: Utility: 5/5, Design: 3/5
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly to lift up my Toyota Corolla 2010. This was with a brand new model, I guess oiling it before use would keep the job simple enough in the future too. Design: does not fit under the trunk with the spare tire. I am keeping the Jack in the Box (pun obviously intended) that it came with, stowed all the way back in a corner of the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Jyot Antani

customer_reviews.title: Lifts well but the crank design is a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.text: The crank is a bit awkward to use, but the jack works smoothly and lifts with little effort. The design of the crank needs review and improvement, it isn't as good as some that have come with cars that I've had to use.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote Griller

customer_reviews.title: Quality Scissors Jack
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, works great. Steady base for safer jacking with good range of lift. Used to assist in RV leveling (raise wheel to insert spacers) which made it easy. Also have on hand for emergency changing of truck/RV flat tires while traveling. Much better and easier to use than jack that came with truck.
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great value compared to similar products. Just needed a little grease on the threaded rod.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I place a puck on the pinch weld that the the jack lifts. Works out very well for my purpose of adjusting my coilovers at the track. The jack is light and compact. As others have mentioned best to keep the screw etc oiled. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike91335

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT! Exceeded Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Exactly what I needed to elevate my zero-turn tractor so I could work on changing it's tires. Jack is heavy and thus sturdy in the way you would want and expect it to be. The turning handle, unlike those that accompany automobiles these days, works effortlessly. It does not catch or snag the ground. It is quite easy to turn and activate the lift. In my opinion, this is a first-rate jack and a steal at the price!
customer_reviews.author: William S. Willer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, basic jack
customer_reviews.text: Lifts a Toyota Camry easily, it’s more work than a floor jack but a cheaper alternative. I’ve used it multiple times now, without issues, always using jack stands for added security. It can be difficult to turn the notch to lift the car, due to the shape of the tool. If the manual aspect is too much, I suggest a floor jack instead. But overall, it’s a solid jack for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Number four and counting..
customer_reviews.text: I grab a couple whenever I see the price drop. Handy for small stuff. Grab a cheapo 7/8" socket while you're at it. Fits perfect over the tab. Speeds things up a lot with a cordless impact. Handles are kinda worthless unless you're really in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Y

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but its not great.
customer_reviews.text: This jack has a large base and I bought it for the stability. But the base attaching point is not as strong as it should be and therefore stability is not really any better than other scissor jacks with smaller bases but that are more well-made. The search goes on...
customer_reviews.author: Rita Schuh

customer_reviews.title: Works OK to lift a light (<1200 pound) camper trailer
customer_reviews.text: The unit seems to be well made and works OK. However the crank handle doesn't lock but hasa a pressure fitting that allows it to be folded and unfolded. I'm not sure how long that will last since unfolded without that will be difficult to keep the handle straight. The unit does work smoothly to lift the trailer and allow me to get jack stands under each side of the axle.
customer_reviews.author: Gregthetenor

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent jack. It doesn't show in the pictures but it includes a really nice crank handle too, with a grip, that folds away. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: C Williams chalupalicous

customer_reviews.title: Great price and a total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Great price and a total waste of money. Could not even lift 1/4 front end my Mazda B-4000. DO NOT BUY !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS PRODUCT DOES NOT MEET STANDARDS WILL FAIL UNDER LOAD AND CAN CAUSE SERIOUS INJURY!
customer_reviews.text: This jack is dangerous the metal is faulty in the screw and pull nut shred and the jack either slips down or is frozen. Torin will not honor the 1 year warranty so buyer beware of this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Skip M

customer_reviews.title: It had nothing but a full tank of gas and apparently the garbage, life-threatening jack can't handle that
customer_reviews.text: The jack that came with my Honda Accord fails and bent on me—luckily when I wasn't under—under normal load. I took precautions and had my tire under the car while changing the brake pads, but it was still nerve wracking to see it bend and snap. It had nothing but a full tank of gas and apparently the garbage, life-threatening jack can't handle that. THANKS HONDA. I don't have time to sue them so I'll just use this instead. It feels a lot sturdier and safe enough to trust my life with.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great jack even for uneven surfaces
customer_reviews.text: The wide foundation of this jack allows for lifting on rocks and dirt without the need for wood, though it would be safer to do so. This jack had no problem lifting my car and was pretty smooth as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Missing Handle Likely Lost in Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Jack seems to work turning by hand.I don't want the hassle of returning it so I'll make a handle.They need an added box for shipping item so handle won't fall out in shipping.
customer_reviews.author: George E.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have a very heavy memory foam mattress and box springs that had slipped off a support bar. I didn’t want my husband to break his back lifting it up to get it back in place. We used this little jack, which was low profile enough to slip under the footboard, and lifted up the whole works with no problem. 5 minutes and best 17 bucks I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: debby

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters car to replace the standard jack. It works great and is much easier to use than the standard jack. Its not super heavy duty, but for the money it will be just fine for the once or twice she may have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jack to lift a heavy 1950's stove in order to slide "Shepherd Hardware 9601 Stamped Steel Adjustable Appliance Rollers, 2-Pack" underneath. Worked like a charm. btw, I did pay FULL Amazon price for both these products, and this is why I bought these items. This jack is sturdy and worth every penny. The hook metal wrench could have been a little better. Overall, the quality was there.
customer_reviews.author: B.Kolar

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit in my 2014 JK.
customer_reviews.text: This jack is decently made but it wouldn't fit nicely in the jack storage area of my Jeep Wrangler JK. It's slightly to big.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Burch

customer_reviews.title: I love this simple jack
customer_reviews.text: Time saver, I love this simple jack. Purchase it with the speed adapter that you can use your drill with. Holds up my Abarth amazingly, purchasing a second one. For safety I shove some hockey pucks in the middle assure it doesn't collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Some random dude

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This cranks up very easily and is a breeze to take down. This is the first scissor jack I've owned and it really beats the bottle jacks. It's sturdy, has a nice base and is surprisingly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brother O

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, safe desing
customer_reviews.text: This jack is better than the OEM one, but much larger. I am conflicted. This jack is more heavy duty and has a fairly large base, that makes it more stable and safer. It is much too large to fit into the trunk jack compartment of our 2007 Honda Accord.
customer_reviews.author: Toledo Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scissor Jack with wide base.  Good price too!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it just yet but I picked this jack because of it's wide base. I also ordered an adapter so I can use my 3 speed, half inch, cordless impact wrench instead of the manual hand crank. No, I'm NOT lazy (lol), I live in FL and during the summer the temps are in the upper 90s and of course the humidity is alway 100000%. lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bet 90% of the other reviews are from people who never actually used this thing. I have. I bought this a replacement for my passat. I thought it was a heavy duty scissor jack. This thing is a piece of junk. The first time I go to use it, it twists and bends and the car falls. To be honest this thing is extremely dangerous. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: The weight rating is optimistic
customer_reviews.text: The threads on the rotating rod was destroyed after lifting up a corner of my 2016 Corolla to change the tire. The entire car weighs about 2800lbs so you'd think a 3000lbs jack would be able to support 1 corner. Nope
customer_reviews.author: James Tang Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for installing sink disposers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for installing/lifting sink disposers - i remembered my plumber used one to replace my last disposer 15 yrs ago worked once -will work again
customer_reviews.author: .Net learner

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This jack was hard to crank to begin with and got stuck while in an up-position with my car on it. I don't even remember all the trouble I went through to get jack to close and to get my car down. I had to trash the jack. So I do not recommend this product. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Omid Kardoust

customer_reviews.title: Trailer jack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my trailer; to carry along in case of emergency. Its pretty nice. The collapsed height is about 4". It comes with a handle that has a hook on one end to turn the jack. The handle folds in half.
customer_reviews.author: spuds4u

customer_reviews.title: Good so far, but I think extra grease is called for.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built, for non-American made, if you know what I mean. Worked like any other scissor jack I've used, but remember that these things can be dangerous and tip easily if not used carefully. This one had a very light coat of grease on the threaded rod. Almost like oil alone. In light of some of the other reviews mentioning massive thread wear, I gave it a good coat of thick grease and the improvement in ease of operation, even under no load, was profound. Hopefully that rod will hold up now.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: This jack saved my butt one morning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jack and picked up a spare tire on Ebay because my car didn't come with a spare or a jack. One morning, on a back road going to work at 530am, I had a blowout. Having one this jack and the spare meant I was able to still get to work on time and get my tire replaced over lunch instead of waiting hours for roadside assistance. The handle folds flat and has a convenient crank shape; the jack goes up quickly and continuously instead of having to flip the handle over every half-turn.
customer_reviews.author: RGM

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for standard equipment
customer_reviews.text: This item, the Torin T10152 arrived super quick. It came with the handle which was a question that I had before I ordered the jack since it wasn't listed as part of the item. It is a replacement for the standard car jack that was ruined when we had to change a flat on the highway and the car was properly blocked. It fits in the cargo space on our car and I hope I don't have to use it, but I have no reservations about its function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get a Dodge Challenger up high enough for a jack stand, but definitely high enough to change a tire at the road side. That's why I bought it, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lostviking

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jack at a great price. It is actually a bit bigger and heavier than I thought. It has a thick red paint job to keep rust away and its included spinner handle works okay though it is a bit clumsy. I've already tested it once and it worked better than expected on my truck. No complaints yet...
customer_reviews.author: Jen Storie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Truly terrible jack. Went crooked on the first use. Definitely not capable of 1.5T.
customer_reviews.author: E. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used car with no jack. Bought this jack. Works fine, but the crank is flimsy/awkward- slow going but gets the job done. OK for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Chitterwick

customer_reviews.title: well built but.
customer_reviews.text: arrived well packaged, but when I try to lift my PWC (535#) on a single place karavan trailer. at one wheel. it was almost the hardest I have ever cranked any thing, Im hopping with use it will free up to work better.. it seem to be well built, and with good material. and is nicely finished.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip H.

customer_reviews.title: Well made jack
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like it was made well. Have not used so far so can't comment about that but I have no reason to think it won't do what it is meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rich G

customer_reviews.title: ) The wide base on this jack is the perfect width to place on a wood block to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I use the jack to raise my boat trailer high enough to swing out the jack stand connected to the front of the trailer. (The jack on the trailer and the height of my car hitch is a real mismatch.) The wide base on this jack is the perfect width to place on a wood block to get the extra height required for this operation. After three months, the jack expands and contracts easily. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. I honestly do not know how it is possible to bring this product to market, sell it for little money and still make a profit. The cost of materials and packaging alone should cost more, let alone design, test and manufacturing. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Good little jack. Has held up well to occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: David Logan

customer_reviews.title: WORKED GREAT...AT FIRST
customer_reviews.text: Had for a month. Worked great for the first 10 times I used it, then it broke on me. When I was jacking up a car, it literally just disengaged and dropped the car to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony K. Fontanilla

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and portable, exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and portable, exactly what I needed. However, if you get it and have trouble cranking it the first time, it seems to be normal, as I had experienced some difficulty turning. The second time I used it, everything required much less effort to crank and was buttery smooth
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: BIG RED T10152 Torin Steel Scissor Lift Jack Car Kit, 1.5 Ton (3,000 lb) Capacity, Red
product_meta.description: The Torin BIG RED T10152 steel scissor lift jack car kit is a collapsible, compact jack can be used as a rugged replacement jack or as an extra utility jack that can be stored in the trunk of your car. Engineered using a drop forged alloyed steel construction for quality and durability and features a lifting range of 4-1/8" to 15-1/8" with a 1.5 ton (3,000 lb) capacity. It's equipped with an extra-wide base which adds stability and strength. The 1 piece handle delivers on-the-spot quick response and speed to get the job done quickly and safely. This unit is 100% factory tested for reliability and safety to meet and comply with ANSI/ASME PASE safety standards. Includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Collapsible, steel scissor lift jack has a compact design that can be used as a rugged replacement jack or as an extra utility jack that can be stored in the trunk of your car
Features a lifting range of 4-1/8" to 15-1/8" with a 1.5 ton (3,000 lb) capacity
Engineered using a drop forged alloyed steel construction for quality and durability
Equipped with an extra-wide base which adds stability and strength; 1 piece handle delivers on-the-spot quick response and speed
Meets ANSI/ASME PASE safety standards and includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty
